reviews.review_msg: I really loved Professor Harter. He was very kind, understanding and answered any questions I had regarding course questions/grading. If you have questions, just ask, don't assume. He was very communicative (e-mail), clear and the course was well structured. Probably one of my favourite professors I've had so far in the 5 years I've attended SFU.
He marks everything easy before the evaluation, so we can give him nice feedback. In fact, he is a tough grader for international students. He just wants to make some easy money.
Never gives efficient feedbacks for assignments till you come to talk to him. tough grader with unclear grading scales.
The grading scale is not clear and not fair at all
This guy is one of the worst teacher you can find in SFU, all the assignment you submitted, you will get the grade like 1 month later. He mark everything just based on his own interest.

Great teacher if you care about the material, very open to students expressing their opinions and having group discussions. If you aren't prepared to participate this class isn't for you. Responsive to emails, and willing to talk after class.

Take any class you can with John-Henry. He is the coolest. Challenging but always willing to spend endless amounts of time talking/emailing you through a problem. Uses lots of film and alternative methods. Super prof.
Excellent prof. Challenging, but very encouraging, and VERY fair. Class discussion was great. Probably some of the most relevant/interesting material of any class I've taken.

He is one of the most passionate,knowledgeable and fair prof in LBST. You need to be actively participating in class but he makes the dry material as relevant&interesting as possible. He is the best lbst prof at sfu. Grading is most fair.He wont judge,play favorites like other profs in LBST. Many lbst profs are unfair bc they lack real experience.

Awesome prof!! One of THE BEST I've had at sfu! Extremely helpful, super knowledgable and pretty funny which makes lectures entertaining. If the class looks interesting to you at all, take it!! If you don't do the reading class discussions are pretty quiet, do it even if you don't understand it, ask questions in class he will definitely explain
Lectures can be entertaining, seminar/interaction portion is bs, assignments have very loose guidelines (kind of lazy on prof's part),class is alright - nothing special
Great prof!!! Although it was not the easiest course I have taken, it is very interesting. Dale is always willing to meet with you outside of class to help you succeed.

My biggest problem with Dale was how his participation system was set up (he tallies each comment you make). I spent hours keeping up with the readings each week, which ended up being useless as class discussions were always hijacked by people BSing about unrelated topics. In the end, my participation mark (worth 20%) suffered because I couldn't BS
fun interesting and aware. I really enjoyed this class and his wisdom
